intro: Cacalia hieracioides, commonly known as the common thistleweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of many small florets. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive lobed shape, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Cacalia hieracioides is often found in disturbed areas and can spread through both seeds and vegetative reproduction.
